DataElement.preferredName: Histopathologic Examination Performed Observation Outcome Involvement Surgical Margin Flag ISO21090.BL.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Specifies whether the margins of surgical resection are infiltrated by the abnormal tissue.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Histopathologic Examination Performed Observation Outcome Involvement Surgical Margin Flag
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The microscopic study of characteristic tissue abnormalities by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains.:Executed and carried through to completion.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:The result of an action._To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.:One of the criteria for assessment of the effectiveness of given surgical procedure in achieving the local control of a neoplasm and the adequacy of tumor removal. It is defined by the tissue plane through which the dissection has been done and the actual or potential neoplastic tissue which has been left outside the boundary of a resected specimen within the patient. There are four types of surgical margins: intracapsular or intralesional, marginal, wide, and radical.:An indicator that can be set or unset in order to signal whether a particular condition is true.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The microscopic study of characteristic tissue abnormalities by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains.:Executed and carried through to completion.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:The result of an action.

Concepts.definition: The microscopic study of characteristic tissue abnormalities by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains.
Executed and carried through to completion.
Watching something and taking note of what happens.

Property.preferredDefinition: To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.:One of the criteria for assessment of the effectiveness of given surgical procedure in achieving the local control of a neoplasm and the adequacy of tumor removal. It is defined by the tissue plane through which the dissection has been done and the actual or potential neoplastic tissue which has been left outside the boundary of a resected specimen within the patient. There are four types of surgical margins: intracapsular or intralesional, marginal, wide, and radical.:An indicator that can be set or unset in order to signal whether a particular condition is true.

Concepts.definition: To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

One of the criteria for assessment of the effectiveness of given surgical procedure in achieving the local control of a neoplasm and the adequacy of tumor removal. It is defined by the tissue plane through which the dissection has been done and the actual or potential neoplastic tissue which has been left outside the boundary of a resected specimen within the patient. There are four types of surgical margins: intracapsular or intralesional, marginal, wide, and radical.
An indicator that can be set or unset in order to signal whether a particular condition is true.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Health Informatics - Harmonized data types for information interchange

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
